title: Voices in the City: Understanding the Role of the City of London as a Multi-Level Policy Actor and the Impact of the Financial Crisis
abstractText:
‘Voices in the City’ sets out to unpack the black box of the City of London by addressing five key questions:

  1. How can we conceptualise the City as a policy actor?
  2. How does the City try to shape the regulatory agenda at multiple levels?
  3. What has been the impact of the global financial crisis on its policy role?
  4. To what extent have its regulatory policy preferences been redefined?
  5. How can we explain the City’s influence within the policy process?

The study explores the political role of the City by mapping its policy preferences and lobbying strategies at the national, European and international level. It does so by analysing a series of case studies related to recent regulatory reform negotiations, including the Basel 3 agreement and EU Capital Requirements Directive IV. The project will draw upon extensive survey data and in-depth interviews with policy makers, industry regulators, trade representatives and members of leading City firms to provide a rich empirical account of how this critically important but hitherto neglected actor wields influence within the policy process.
